entry.title: my poems
entry.summary: you were there walking down the isle, i see a beautiful girl with a heart to lift staying low is what i all got keeping myself away not to bother…
entry.content:
you were there

walking down the isle, i see
a beautiful girl with a heart to lift
staying low is what i all got
keeping myself away not to bother alot
you were there

you were there when i first saw you
the times when i sneaked you
even when I couldn't ask you out
you were there to listen me up

i waited for the time right
you waited for me at the sight
even we lived apart in this middle
you were there

you were there to take all
to accept and for love
you were there
you were there...
hope

i dream i live, in this world so big
i live i ride, in these high tides
i ride i find, adventure and kind
i find i hope, to live in all scope
i hope i smile, there is no fade alive
i smile i see, person who is close to me
i see i feel, the magic of her heal
i feel i move, like the steady groove
i move i'm closer, to the breath you lower
i'm closer and enough, the hope is perfectly made up ‚ù§Ô∏è
lockdown

for the morning i wake
i feel the sound of yours
even the chirping bird
feels noisy after yours
in this effect of lockdown
even we stay apart
but with the heart so close
we are closest to each hearts
no old we become
in these running time
its the bond within us
keeps stronger by every second we rhyme ‚ù§Ô∏è

entry.content:
hello friends,

glad to see you here, the app is basically to aware you on the hot topics of devOps around the world. I will try here to collect and write articles on different devOps issues and technologies related to same.

i will cover the implementation as well with most of the common and uncommon approaches using mostly open source tools.¬†

so lets start with the first article on devOps here

if you do like the articles and just thought of following me by chance, please feel free to do so, don't be shy üòú

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†

entry.title: what is devOps ? (Continue...)
entry.summary: what is devOps ? (Continue...)i hope you are coming after reading this article as here i have explained what exaclty devOps is and why are we going through this process.
entry.content:
what is devOps ? (Continue...)

i hope you are coming after reading this article as here i have explained what exaclty devOps is and why are we going through this process. in this article i will brief some more information on devOps by depicting some images below so that a good insight can be made on it.¬†

so, what challenges does devOps solves?

when the teams work separately and by team i mean the dev, QA and the ops, Dev is often unaware of QA and Ops blockers that prevent the program from working as expected, at the other hand QA and Ops are typically working across many features and they have little context of the business purpose and value of the software by this what we see that each group has quite resisting goals which can lead to inefficiency or you can say fingure pointing when something goes wrong.¬†

and here devOps addresses these challenges by bridging and creating a cross functional teams that shares responsibility of maintaining the system that runs the software.

you can see how devOps collaborates the process of development, testing and deployment.

just to make everyone clear that, devOps is not a tool. i am into the phase of learning it and i have find its more of a process or you can typically say a culture that needs to be adabpted to work in. what i have experienced so far is, as much as you dig yourself into this culture you will enjoy the workplace you have established for yourself. devOps deals with such real time scenarios where you can not be late, it has to be bang on or you will have to face loses as well.¬†

its not just a healthy culture in the technology era but you will find devOps around you yourself for sure in life lessons as well

will catch you real soon with some more realistic technical writings with philosophical thinking.

read my medium article on parallel love here

entry.content:
parallel love |‚ù§Ô∏è|

¬†

The¬†world is facing a situation of lock down, unlocks, re openings or I would say we are trying to put things back to normal or at least close to normal. But you yourself know deep down inside, its never gonna happen. It‚Äôs hard to accept right? but I think this is the time we should consider this as what normal is to.

many in this world died due to the¬†COVID¬†impact, it was no less and there came news where people lost lives at early ages due to suicide, I am sorry but I have to use the word here, I don‚Äôt want to put any negative thoughts in your mind but moving forward I will try to embrace you to what we should achieve and not putting such thoughts whatsoever happens in our lives.

The title¬†parallel love¬†sure is hitting you right now, or ringing bells that what I actually want to tell here. it‚Äôs no common we love, we love our family, friends and I guess a lot of people. and that‚Äôs an amazing part of what love is all about, its no tangible but it is what it is. you feel it, you accept it, many of us eat, drink and dance it, yes I am no kidding here, its no weapon but its a gift we all have we can share any time every time anywhere or everywhere‚Ä¶Umm am I right on that part? I feel my self ....read more

entry.title: what is devOps
entry.summary: what is devOps Before going into what devOps is I will try to cover how this word is derived. If you can just look at the word "devOps" it…
entry.content:
what is devOps

Before going into what devOps is I will try to cover how this word is derived. If you can just look at the word "devOps" it certainly looks a combination of dev and Ops. Here dev refers to the Development and Ops refers to the Operations.

In back days operations department was responsible for the deployment of builds (applications) and there was less or no involvement of the development team members in the deployment process. But there always a syncing problem exists between the developers and the operations team members resulting in extended timeline in the deployment of the build or say build coming under production so that they can be used by the end users. 

What the hell are you talking about? we were still able to perform the deployment in those times too, what devOps changed? 

Perfect question. devOps collaborated the developers to work with operations teams at the same time. What resulted in no syncing issues, if there exists any deployment issues due to some failure happening due to the build provided by the development team, the resolution happens within time making the operations team to deploy the build into production without any extension in the timeline.

is that it?

No, its not over yet. devOps can be completely an automated process, how we will learn into coming articles. 

till then, thanks for the read...keep visiting, keep learning 

read the devOps part 2 here
